message.content:
cs.RO, cs.SY, cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI. 

The paper proposes a control law for autonomous unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs), specifically quadcopters, to track aggressive trajectories with high-speed and high-acceleration maneuvers. This falls under the category of robotics (cs.RO). The proposed method utilizes incremental nonlinear dynamic inversion (INDI) for accurate tracking of linear and angular accelerations despite external disturbances, which falls under the category of control systems (cs.SY). The paper also utilizes differential flatness of the quadcopter dynamics to generate feedforward inputs for attitude rate and attitude acceleration, which falls under the category of machine learning (cs.LG) and computer vision (cs.CV). Finally, the paper rigorously analyzes the proposed controller through response analysis, which falls under the category of artificial intelligence (cs.AI).
